main_definition: The Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) is an international organization that works to build better policies for better lives, promoting policy solutions for governments and societies worldwide.

meanings_and_examples.example: The OECD (Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development) is an international organization comprising of 38 countries.
Through its work, the OECD aims to promote policies that improve economic performance and social well-being among member countries.
The OECD provides a platform for dialogue and exchange of best practices on development issues such as poverty reduction, sustainable development, and environmental protection.
